author: {'steamid': '76561198121632304', 'num_games_owned': 375, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 514, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 147, 'last_played': 1465604926}
review:
One thing is for sure the game needs a bigger community,  For the people that clicked on the help button and learned to play, good on you, for the jerks who dinied the game a chance because there wasnt a tutorial, goto hell.

As An indie game it truly has spirit and mindfullness, but the lack of human players kills the entire experiance, yes it does have bots, but nce you learn the game, the bots ar hardly a challenge, what this game needs is people who can see the good in it, and bring along a nice community, unfortunately, finding a MP match is nearly impossible, and the rare time there is one, they have no idea of what to do, If a youtuber [other than myself] reads this, I ask that you spotlight this under-appreciated game and all its brilliance.

PS, Hey noobs, dont complain about a dead community on an indie game, thats just a d**k move.

author: {'steamid': '76561198065822102', 'num_games_owned': 192, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 132, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 87, 'last_played': 1536039563}
review:
Highly recommended.  Genuinely not enough players to do this game justice.  This is one of the most exciting, satisfying, and downright fun games I've played in my many many years as a gamer.  If I were asked to describe it, it's basically space Quidditch if you were to throw in a splash of Unreal Tournament and Tribes: Ascend.

The object is to take control of the ball placed in the center of the field and get it into the opposing team's goal, which then rewards you with a seed that you can plant on a platform adjacent to either your own goal, or a platform on which you've already planted a seed, which will then give a stat buff of your choosing to your entire team (Speed, Jump height, etc) and will also create a plant with abilities such as shielding or energy turrets which are activated (or deactivated by the enemy) using your meth (methylation) glove.  The game is won either by the team with the most goals when the timer runs out, or by the first team to plant a seed on the opposing team's goal.

Among the tools you have to accomplish these objectives are:
- An energy blaster, which has a short travel time and can knock opponents or the ball around, messing up their trajectories or assisting passes to teammates.
- A hitscan beam shot with a slower rate of fire and reduced repulsive capability.
- Various powerups scattered across certain platforms in the playing field, such as Boost (gives you a big push in the direction you're aiming), Grapple (sends a grappling hook in the direction of your crosshair, which pulls you in that direction), and Push (generates a small explosion around you, pushing away other players. I'm unsure of the official name), among others.

I VERY much recommend this game, as a gamer and as a critic.  It's something relatively innovative in the way it implements the features and mechanics it uses, isn't very hard to get into after a few rounds, and is simply a LOT of fun, plus it's very cheap for the entertainment value, plus it runs at very high and wonderfully smooth framerates on most modern machines, and can be turned down to run just fine even on some older ones so more people can enjoy what this game has to offer.  As well, it's non-violent, so parents who are mindful of what their kids play, or just don't like violence will be happy to know that the game doesn't have a health or damage system, deaths, or blood, just pure clean fun.

I'd give it a 9/10

TL;DR - You won't regret buying this game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198104307652', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 337, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 216, 'last_played': 1546891433}

author: {'steamid': '76561197970064749', 'num_games_owned': 5475, 'num_reviews': 359, 'playtime_forever': 90, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 14, 'last_played': 1428851119}
review:
Epigenesis mixes First Person Shooter with sports in a Sci-Fi universe. Grab the ball before your opponent does, jump platforms, do not fall down, pick up some powerups and throw towards their goal to score. If your opponent has the ball you obviously defend your goal and try to take them down. 

Overall Epigenesis is a really fun game but suffers from the same disease many indie multiplayer games do these days: lack of players. If you can find a few people to play with, you will have a really fun time. 

I do think this game deserves more players than it currently has so if you're looking for a party game, get this one.

author: {'steamid': '76561198041491398', 'num_games_owned': 915, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 6871, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5847, 'last_played': 1540587477}
review:
"Great game to play competitive.
It has quite a learning curve but the (small) community is really active and has great support for new players if you stick around on the teamspeak. The community even hosts tournaments twice a year where you can win sweet prizes!
I've put a lot of hours into this, it's no casual game, but if you get into it it's really tons of fun." ~~IcyDwarf


"If you like fast-paced action but are tired of first person shooters in which one shot is enough to kill you, you'll probably like this game. And if you like parkour and ball games, you'll like it even more. Even the tower defense fans will love this game!" ~~ProtoQuantum

Epigenesis presents a promising take on the next few hundred years: no grim future centered entirely on war, no post-apocalyptic earth where Darwinian human instinct has taken over; instead, humanity created the most popular sport in history, some strange hybrid of Basketball, Soccer, and Unreal Tournament. It's also an interesting case for why "e-sports" doesn't necessarily have to conjure up images of multiplayer battle arenas and first-person shooters, but that more traditional (albeit fictional) sports can exist in that space alongside the likes of Dota 2 and Counter-Strike. I really like what Epigenesis represents: it's an innovative take on traditional sports that still provides the adrenaline rush of something like Quake or Unreal Tournament, in a well-produced package that you rarely see in games fresh out of Steam's Early Access.


"In Epigenesis, two teams face off in an attempt to plant a ball inside an enemy's goal more times in ten minutes than the opposition across a platformed ravine. The arenas aesthetically resemble something out of Tron but play like something out of Quake. Each player is given a non-lethal laser with two modes: rail (an instant, focused beam which pushes enemies back a small amount) and shot (a mode which fires a missile-like projectile which travels slowly but produces an explosion that pushes back enemies a lot). The gun is a key part of both offense and defense -- pushing an enemy back and causing them to fall off a ledge or preventing them from landing on one in the first place spells instant death, producing a 5-second respawn timer. In addition, hitting an enemy who's in the air with your melee attack sends them straight downward, and if they fail to land on a platform? Splat.

In order to score a goal, a player has to pick up the ball from the middle of the arena, take it to the enemy goal, and toss it in. It's simple, but when presented with power-ups like "smokescreen" (which creates a cloud of smoke over a large area for a few seconds), along with arena-based hazards (like the desert maps' Twister, which pulls players it catches high up into the air), it gets complex and interesting. Upon scoring, a player is given a seed, which they can plant on one of the unoccupied platforms, which in turn spawns a plant, a kind of "turret" which produces effects ranging from firing projectiles which slow enemies, to creating a shield in which players can hide. In addition, each plant provides the entire team with a buff to either jump height or speed. Each player also has a gauntlet called a "meth-glove," whose use is two-fold: the first, called "methylation," allows a player to power up a plant; the other, called "demethylation," allows them to cause an enemy's plant to wither and eventually become inactive. It's here where the strategy of Epigenesis starts to shine: its rules are deceptively easy to learn, but when other humans are thrown into the mix, their collective strategies coalesce into something truly spectacular." ~~Tamriilin

review:
Great game to play competitive.
It has quite a learning curve but the (small) community is really active and has great support for new players if you stick around on the teamspeak. The community even hosts tournaments twice a year where you can win sweet prices!
I've put a lot of hours into this, it's no casual game, but if you get into it it's really tons of fun.

author: {'steamid': '76561198093302385', 'num_games_owned': 310, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 8, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 8, 'last_played': 1431934562}
review:
+ Sci-Fi version of Quidditch, with awesome guns and boosters.  
+ Amazing concept.
+ Sweet visuals / aesthetics. 
+ Can be played with BOTs.

- Bad implementation of the Idea.
- Chunky controls.
- Dead online community, hard to find players.

Rating: 5/10 or maybe borderline 6/10 ~ 5.5/10

It's one of those titles which I'd like to give a 'NEUTRAL' rating, but since that can't be done.   
I'll 'NOT' be recommending the game unless you can get a couple of friends to play it with you.

review: It's hard to play this game because of the lack of other people who play it. But that one time, when you find a server that has 1 or 2 other people on, and you join it, it is some of the best gameplay I ever had. The game has an interesting gamestyle, almost like  basketball, but with low gravity, and guns. Something great about this game is that the guns don't actually kill you, they just push you, causing you to fall off the edge. This face-paced game, despite the lack of players, is very fun. I'm almost always smiling, or laughing when playing this game, there just needs to be more people who play it.

author: {'steamid': '76561197971885389', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 43, 'playtime_forever': 136, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 136, 'last_played': 1407529268}
review:
Epigenesis presents a promising take on the next few hundred years: no grim future centered entirely on war, no post-apocalyptic earth where Darwinian human instinct has taken over; instead, humanity created the most popular sport in history, some strange hybrid of Basketball, Soccer, and Unreal Tournament.  It's also an interesting case for why "e-sports" doesn't necessarily have to conjure up images of multiplayer battle arenas and first-person shooters, but that more traditional (albeit fictional) sports can exist in that space alongside the likes of Dota 2 and Counter-Strike. I really like what Epigenesis represents: it's an innovative take on traditional sports that still provides the adrenaline rush of something like Quake or Unreal Tournament, in a well-produced package that you rarely see in games fresh out of Steam's Early Access.


In Epigenesis, two teams face off in an attempt to plant a ball inside an enemy's goal more times in ten minutes than the opposition across a platformed ravine. The arenas aesthetically resemble something out of Tron but play like something out of Quake. Each player is given a non-lethal laser with two modes: rail (an instant, focused beam which pushes enemies back a small amount) and shot (a mode which fires a missile-like projectile which travels slowly but produces an explosion that pushes back enemies a lot).  The gun is a key part of both offense and defense -- pushing an enemy back and causing them to fall off a ledge or preventing them from landing on one in the first place spells instant death, producing a 5-second respawn timer. In addition, hitting an enemy who's in the air with your melee attack sends them straight downward, and if they fail to land on a platform? Splat.

In order to score a goal, a player has to pick up the ball from the middle of the arena, take it to the enemy goal, and toss it in. It's simple, but when presented with power-ups like "smokescreen" (which creates a cloud of smoke over a large area for a few seconds), along with arena-based hazards (like the desert maps' Twister, which pulls players it catches high up into the air), it gets complex and interesting. Upon scoring, a player is given a seed, which they can plant on one of the unoccupied platforms, which in turn spawns a plant, a kind of "turret" which produces effects ranging from firing projectiles which slow enemies, to creating a shield in which players can hide. In addition, each plant provides the entire team with a buff to either jump height or speed. Each player also has a gauntlet called a "meth-glove," whose use is two-fold: the first, called "methylation," allows a player to power up a plant; the other, called "demethylation," allows them to cause an enemy's plant to wither and eventually become inactive. It's here where the strategy of Epigenesis starts to shine: its rules are deceptively easy to learn, but when other humans are thrown into the mix, their collective strategies coalesce into something truly spectacular.

At least, that's what I assume happens.

You see, Epigenesis' community is dead. And when I say "dead," I don't mean "there are a few full servers," I mean there are two or three people playing the multiplayer at any given time. It's disheartening, because playing against the AI only provides a challenge until you're out-thinking and out-pacing them, and with a complete lack of single-player campaign, its appeal only lasts for so long before you're wanting something richer. I only got to play a single match against real people, and it wasn't even a full house -- there were four people (two on each team) with the other six slots filled by AI. I'm sure that if I'd gotten to play more of the multiplayer component I would have enjoyed Epigenesis way more, but unfortunately, that's what often happens with Early Access titles: people play them obsessively for a few weeks or months and move on, and then when the game comes out nobody is still playing it.

THE VERDICT

Epigenesis is a strong case for why e-sports doesn't necessarily have to be entirely composed of the likes of League of Legends and Unreal Tournament. It is, unfortunately, a product of the all-too-common disease I have taken to calling "Early Access Syndrome," in which a game's community is essentially non-existent on official release. I'd stay away unless you're buying the four-pack with the intention to play with other people you know, or are content playing against bots -- not because it's a bad game, but because the community just does not exist.

author: {'steamid': '76561198047741247', 'num_games_owned': 328, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 19, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 9, 'last_played': 1438461214}
review:
I had fun watching the vids and couldn't wait to play it!

When I first learned how to play, the controls were easy to understand and the playstyle really interesting. The graphics and the sounds effect on the game are without a doubt amazing. All the sound effect on this game makes us feel like a badass. Strong music with violent effect really feels awesome! 

 The biggest issue of this game, which puts this game with a score of 8/10, is the community. In fact, when I bought the game and wanted to play online the community was inexistent. Not even a single server had 1 player in it, I was playing alone on all of those servers. Watching all those vid seemed like the game was HUGE, but really it's not that big and in fact one of the smallest community I have ever seen. Hopefully, the community will grow and we will be able to play a real 6v6 match.

Despite the fact that theres not a bunch of weapon variety, this game is fun to play with all the weapons. The maps seems ok but I couldn't really appreciate it at there full potential since the lack of the cummunity. Seeds how ever, are an amazing aspect of this game, making the maps customizable and also allowing player to create some fun strategies throughout the game. 

In the end, the game is really promissing, really fun to play. But the only way to really appreciate the game would be having a larger community. I recommend this game to any fps player who love a challenging game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198114209157', 'num_games_owned': 188, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 64, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 14, 'last_played': 1408897678}
review:
This is incredibly fun game to play, and I wish I could recommend it to others. Unfortunately there is a major lack of community at the moment, in what is primarily a multiplayer game. Because of this I have found myself stuck playing the unchallenging (and frankly quite boring) single player which is simply not worth the price tag the game comes with.

I'm hoping that I can change my opinion on Epigeness, as it has a load of potential. As the community grows, I'm sure my fondness for the game will too, but as it stands I wouldn't waste your money unless you're prepared for a pretty slow growing player base.

author: {'steamid': '76561198116975671', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 81, 'playtime_forever': 7, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 7, 'last_played': 1404284044}
review:
Like so many games on Steam, I absolutely love the concept of this game, but find the execution leaving much to be desired. Sports games are underrepresented, especially on PC, and there are even fewer examples of games that use the theoretical gaming environment to present a new conceptual sport. This hybrid extreme rugby / gridiron football / dodge ball / gymnastics / etc -type of challenge is really an entertaining concept.

Unfortunately, the gameplay is clunky and lags graphically too often, and especially at critical times, it seems.

Could be a 9+, but due to the mediocre controls and glitchy action it is hard to hate or love in any definitive manner. 
Meh. [ 5 /10 ]

author: {'steamid': '76561198119083027', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 216, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 76, 'last_played': 1526899798}
review: Sehr schönes Spiel, wenn auch noch nicht ganz ausgereift. Aber ist ja noch im Earli Access :). Vielleicht stellt der Trailer das Spiel etwas besser da als es momentan ist, aber mit Updates nimmt es immer weiter diese Form an. Ich habe bis jetzt auch noch nie ein Spiel mit so einem Gameplay gesehen. Natürlich kann und sollte man noch einiges hinzufügen und/oder verändern. Aber ich denke mal der VersionsName sagt so einiges :). Generell ist das Spiel so aufgebaut, dass man den Ball in das gegnerische Tor befördern muss. Hat man das geschafft kann man z.B. ein Turret oder eine Rampe pflanzen. Leider verliehrt man diese Möglichkeit wenn man runter fällt. Was auch noch ein kleines Problem ist, dass wenn schon alles beplanzt worden ist, man sich in den Tod stürzen muss um keinen, ich nenn es jetzt mal Samen, mehr zu haben und wieder den Ball nehmen zu können oder wieder schießen zu können. Die Schüsse stoßen die Gegner weg so das er runterfällt und den Ball verliehrt. Das ist das grobe Prinzip vom Spiel. Es gibt dann noch ein Menü in dem man seine Samen einstellen kann und noch ein paar andere Sachen. Ich hab nur jetzt nicht wirklich viel Lust das aufzuschreiben :D. Was ich sehr schade finde ist, dass kaum Leute das Spiel online spielen. Hoffe das wird sich noch ändern :). Sooo.. und jetzt hab ich auch keine Lust mehr hier weiter zu schreiben :D.

author: {'steamid': '76561198108008582', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 26, 'playtime_forever': 23, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 23, 'last_played': 1403190610}
review: primero, este juego, (si lo compran como yo, osea, sin amigos con los que jugar este mismo), no se lo recomiendo a muchos, la estrategia basica es buena, es como una partida al estilo futurama de "balon mano" o como le digan al juego en su pais, es simple y sencillo, meter la bola en el "arco" contrario y ganar puntaje, ademas hay unos poderes y arboles, creo, pero todo esto se va al caño cuando quieres jugar con alguien, y si ningun amigo tuyo tiene esta madre de juego, pues los servidores estaran vacios (99% de las veces), o estran llenos (se llenan con partida privadas o solo con amigos), ademas esta muy ver, solo 2 mapas y listo, no es mas, no se puede modificar tu jugador, ni la bola, nada, siempre sera la misma madre, recomendaciones, no comprarlo AUN!, esta muy verde, y si lo compran, recomiendenlo o regalenselo a unos 9 amigos mas, por que si no estaran de forever alone en una partida inexistente!.

author: {'steamid': '76561198077161308', 'num_games_owned': 1297, 'num_reviews': 203, 'playtime_forever': 1277, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1277, 'last_played': 1402585371}
review:
I selfishly want to recommend this game just to try to get more people to play to actually experience what it could be because I really liked the idea and feel. But, I cannot.

I became enamored with the game over a free weekend. The sparsely populated servers with people as new and clueless as me made the game seem fun and the three-something dollar price tag appealing. I bit. 

Over the course of the next week or two the population disappeared. But I was able to learn the nuances of the game and navigate the not-steep, but completely unexplained, learning curve thanks to spotty appearances of other players. This made the game seem fun all over again. Over the following weeks I became comfortable with the game and really enjoyed the few times another human was actually on a server. Some players were better, a lot were as lost as I previously was.

But in the end, I never witnessed a game larger than 2v3. Morning, noon or night. Any day of the week. Any server from West to East to Europe to Asia. There just isn't people playing this game. Perhaps some games just shouldn't be open betas or 'Early Access'? People were done and bored before it had legs. 

Or perhaps other issues are really holding it back.

The learning curve isn't hard but requires other players to actually learn. There's documentation of what items do or how to prime your two jumps. But nothing about the useful ways to use the items, tactics to employ, using momentum from items/jumps/enemy fire, etc. All things you can only learn with a live enemy. And I still feel like I only really learned how to play 1v1 and what tactics to use in that situation because that's all I ever got to regularly.

The devs have an idea of what they believe gameplay *should* be like if you read around the web some. In the perfect world all the servers would be 5v5 and somebody would be playing "goalie" and people would pass the ball. Combine those Ideas with the game that really does feel smooth and man that sounds great!

But the dead community means you'll rarely see 5v5 or in my case; never. I tried to play "goalie" in a 2v2 after I had read about the concept on a forum. But it's just not a logical choice to do when you aren't realistically going to stop many chances.

And passing? That would make the game that much more interesting but the speed of the players (especially once powerups are planted) makes that a colossal undertaking to time correctly. And because of this, nobody ever expects a pass. I never witnessed anybody else even attempt one. 

I could go on and on. Its a great concept that is fairly polished and fun in theory. But has a dead community and suffers from a multitude of other problems. I could never recommend it even at the price I paid much less it's regular price. My twenty-plus hours of play consists of maybe five with other players and maybe three of those five hours was "competitive" play rather than goofing around. The vast majority of my play time was spent alone achievement hunting. The bots are awful.

If it gets lots of people suddenly, better maps (another issue I didn't delve into), and one or two other things I forgot to whine about... And it's like $0.99USD. Consider it.

review: Although this review says yes, I would like to point out that this is an Alpha game, and it reflects that in the game itself. With very simple maps, no real 'WOW' factor, and only moderately decent servers, this game is really only worth the buy if it is on sale. A fun sports game, it gives a break from the Shooters that dominate just about everything. I enjoy playing it, but I will love playing it after it gets some work done.

review: Not fun. The jump is extremely delayed, even once you figure out you charge the jump, it doesn't always go right away. It jump when fully charged seems to change in how high it boosts you. When you use the thing that boosts you up, you cant jump even though you use a jetpack like thing?  I haven't played it much but in a game where movement is so important, the difficulty i had moving around made this not fun during my time playing it. I'm a fan of twitch shooters but this game just isn't fun.

review: When I first started this game it was completely new to me, the game gravity was weird, the functions of the weapons and power ups was weird, let's say the whole thing was foreign even with a cool show of graphics. The actual game takes real skill, especially on PC?(easier if it was an Xbox game). Just trying not to fall off the map your first time is hard enough, let alone fight enemies at the same time. To put it simply, this game is like floating low gravity paintball with real guns. Okay, that sounds amazingly fun, and yes it would be, but this game doesn't pull that off as well as they might like to. I still can't quite get the sight to shoot to hit technique down. Not sure if the bullet insta-hits or if it travels to hit them while they move. It's a mess, but when you play with bots or experienced players, they have no problem! The game is actually pretty good, unique, interesting, and fun when you get the hang of it. I would say it is worth the money, especially on sale. Rating for this one, 7.5/10 for no backstory, plot, botless singleplayer, and it deserves an in game tutorial which it lacks. Have fun with it!

author: {'steamid': '76561198132993824', 'num_games_owned': 105, 'num_reviews': 28, 'playtime_forever': 18, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5, 'last_played': 1558784663}
review: Epigenesis is now beta but it seems to be perfect game. This game actually is not action, it's FPS Sport. This game is different than other FPS multiplayer that gives player freedom to choose scoring a goal or taking down opponent. Unfortunately there's just 2 map available in this game, but all of them have a great design and colorfull. Now about gameplay, Player starting in their side playing as Omani or Argos, after time countdown player now can leave their base and begin the match. In the match killikng/taking down other opponent won't give you additional score but it give you advantages to hold the ball and score a goal easily. In every base there are a ring, player must throw the ball there to score a goal. A simple gameplay right? but this game is fun and addictive.

author: {'steamid': '76561198000349663', 'num_games_owned': 387, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 4550, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 531, 'last_played': 1673255528}
review:
Epigenesis ist meiner Meinung nach ein sehr gelungenes Spiel. Eine geringe Gewaltrate, da man ja um einen Ball kämpft und sich nicht unbedingt über den Haufen schießen muss.

Derzeit ist natürlich noch nicht viel los. Deutsche Leute die das Spiel gekauft haben nachdem es kostenlos auf steam war gibt es wenige, was natürlich durch das Early Access zustande kommen mag oder weil viele dieses Spiel langweilig finden. derzeit sind 2 Maps für den SIngleplayer gegen Bots (im SP maximal 5 vs. 5) und 4 Arenan im Multiplayer

Server sind soweit schon online. 5 European, 2 Russian, 1 Asian und noch ein paar andere.

Ich hoffe das Spiel bleibt so gut und freue mich wenn Leute es mit mir spielen :D

Update: leider tot, schade schade

author: {'steamid': '76561198001014053', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 23, 'playtime_forever': 18, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 18, 'last_played': 1399217834}
review:
Quake III +Rugby - the contact because everyone is armed with futuristic Weapons.  A good place to start for people new to first person shooters, as it will give you an unobstructed view as you learn to lead moving targets, and where to aim when you are also moving.  There's plenty here for more advanced shooters too.  You will need to formulate strategies against a continuously moving foe in order to advance the ball and hopefully, eventually score. For the defending side its a matter of preventing the other team from scoring, and gaining control of the ball for your team. There are several different races to choose from, each with its own set of advantages and disadvantages all of which need to be taken into account as you advance the ball or try to take it from your opponent.

The game can be played either solo or online. If playing solo you will be playing the lower level games against two bots and will have one bot as a team mate. If you play online you will be matched with players of similar ability to the degree that is possibe (during off hours there may not be a very large pool of people available and the ability levels of opponents may become quite disperate).

I can't say that this game will be for everyone, if it becomes available for a free weekend then definitely give it a go, or if it goes on sale and you are a fan of FPS and of team sport, then definitely drop the cash for this one.

author: {'steamid': '76561198079863152', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 85, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 83, 'last_played': 1437952841}
review:
Eu gostei desse jogo. No geral eu não gosto muito de FPS ou de jogos de esporte, mas combinou MUITO FPS com esporte, MUITO mais divertido (sair pulando pelas plataformas, atirar nos outros).
Jogabilidade normal de um FPS (do que eu estou acostumada) e os gráficos são bons (não são perfeitos, mas eu gostei).

author: {'steamid': '76561198041819640', 'num_games_owned': 162, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 41, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 41, 'last_played': 1399050681}
review:
Epigenesis è uno di quei giochi con un ottima idea di fondo, ma una pessima realizzazione. Partiamo con il setting: i giocatori si trovano in un ambientazione futuristica composta da piattaforme sospese nel vuoto, con lo scopo di recuperarae una palla al centro della mappa per poi segnare nella rete avversaria sfruttando delle "piante" che forniscono bonus attivi e passivi e un'arma incorporata nel braccio dei giocatori per spingere di sotto gli altri concorrenti.
L'idea è incredibilmente originale, ma viene del tutto o quasi oscurata da un comparto tecnico penoso: la cura per i dettagli grafici è del tutto assente, il frame rate, già basso, subisce continui cali anche nelle squenze meno concitate e le animazioni dei personaggi, che dovrebbero essere il fulcro di un gioco basato su un simil-parkour, sono legnose, lente e, come i comandi, prive di reattività.
I "server" che dovrebbero migliorare il gioco presentano una qualità di connessione che lascia molto a desiderare in ogni situazione, che rende molto frustante iniziare un salto, bloccarsi a mezz'aria e poi trovarsi già nel baratro infinito presente in ogni mappa senza possibilità di salvezza.
Proprio le mappe sono un'altra nota dolente del gioco, poichè presentano, salvo alcune eccezioni, un ambiente piatto e speculare, privo di spunti tattici.
Allo stato attuale non è per nulla consigliabile, nonostante il setting intrigante.

author: {'steamid': '76561198077639806', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 32, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 32, 'last_played': 1399153521}
review:
Firstly, it's in fair shape for an early access, and it's had a good update history, so don't be scared away by that. It does start with some wonky graphics settings, but after adjusting them it looks and plays pretty well, and many of the astetics (like the hideous alpha-style menus) will likely be fixed as more polish is added to the game.

Now, onto the game itself. It remindes me a lot of a ball game mode from Unreal Tournament concept wise. It essentially uses shoot mechanics in a hoop and ball game similar to soccer (football), however it leans more heavely on the sports side of the shooter-sports hybrid. It is a high flying, high speed, and it does suffer a bit from a lack of feedback on landings and jump hieghts, but that forces you to pay attention to both the game and the platforms (I'd recomend using the highest FOV settings to help), as falling to your death is a constant threat. There are a lot of deep mechanics and power ups that make this game very strategic and competetive; It probably has the potental to compete with CS:GO's competitive scene. 

Over all, I would recomend this to someone who dislikes CoD style shooters but enjoyed the interesting gamemodes from old competitive games like Unreal Tournament, Counter Strike, and Quake Arena.

author: {'steamid': '76561197972392543', 'num_games_owned': 1097, 'num_reviews': 122, 'playtime_forever': 9, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 9, 'last_played': 1399073719}
review:
So, let's talk about game design for a few moments. When designing a multiplayer game, of any sort, one of the most vile and hated things that can happen is the "Roll" as it were. Now, what you do not do is make a game where the enemy team, provided sufficient advantage, is rewarded by rolling with more and more benefits to the point that it is difficult to ever recover from said roll. Provided, I never got to that point.

I just spent the most frustrating eight minutes of my life simply trying to get to the center platform to get the ball. The rest of my team spent their time running about with a chicken with their head cut off and the enemy team wasn't much better. THey were only winning because they figured out a route that basically there's very little chance to stave them off of. There's a boost platform that throws them directly into the goal, yet no counter boost platform. Closest one lands you three platforms away. So basically it means you need someone to stand there and guard... of course the person standing still will just get hit and thrown off the platform. The game is schizo about its speed, alternating between me sitting with my thumb up my ass to get the three power blocks of jump to get anywhere, and rushing about to try to stop the enemy ball carrier. I wasn't even mad the enemy team was winning. I was just getting annoyed of the booster blocks kept not working and the majority of time I spent playing could be classified as flailing hopeless against fate and waiting for my jump to charge. Also the jump charging is retarded, and the game should just fix it to three-power basic. 75% of the platforms in the map I was on couldn't be reached WITHOUT three power, so what's the point of lower powers if they don't provide you anything but schmuck bait? 

Also thanks for the how to do that tells me I have two weapons without telling me how to swap them.

author: {'steamid': '76561198072214814', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 6, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 6, 'last_played': 1399033785}
review:
[b]Epigenesis[/b] is an interesting take on the multiplayer FPS-genre, but it also requires patience. Unfortunately I gave up rather quickly when I had problems with jumping across the platforms: steering is (a bit) difficult and it is apparent that in order to make a successful "normal" jump, the player has to charge the jump-button.

When I play a FPS-game, I would like to have no problems with controlling the character. So no, [u]I can't recommend this game[/u] at this time.

But thanks for letting us players try it out.

author: {'steamid': '76561197998784855', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 37, 'playtime_forever': 638, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 477, 'last_played': 1399230931}
review:
While SmashBall is about having nerves of steel and fulfilling your chosen role, Epigenesis is more of a thinking man's game. It's strategic action, it's truly a sport with original (as far as I've seen) game mechanics, and it avoids feeling like a team deathmatch that has Those-Objectives-That-Mean-Nothing. Pick up the ball from the center and throw it through the enemy's gate, and you earn a seed to customize. Bring it safely to an uncaptured node, and you will earn a team bonus and a structure of your choosing.

Personally, I prefer ramps with an air control team bonus (Option 2 of Loadout 1) so that my teammates and I have vantage points, can advance across the field faster, can dodge and pursue enemies better, and avoid falling as often. And I really want extreme air control with ramps everywhere, so I focus on the objective and work with people. That way I can separate myself from multiple pursuers if I run back to my side of the field, take a ramp, and change direction to fool the remainder who anticipate the ramp getting used. Oh, best part yet? Take a seed to the enemy's gate with a neighboring node under your control, and you will instantly win the game for your team.

Fun? Yes. Recommended? Yes. I'd join the official Epigenesis group if you're looking to buy it; a little community effort and a few new friends should help keep your games full and interesting.

author: {'steamid': '76561198040255434', 'num_games_owned': 315, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 142, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 115, 'last_played': 1406926195}
review:
Tough decision, but I'd say yes. This is recommended.

Pros
-No games like it.
-Fast paced
-Sci-fi type
-Powerups to save yourself, or mess with others
-Nice graphics
-Updated fairly frequently
-Bots to play against. And not terrible AI either, pretty good.
-Some achievements
-3 different loadout (only tried 1 though)

Cons
-NOBODY is online unless either devs announce they, or you bring a friend
-Menus are a tad bit ugly
-No effective passing to teammates? Its a huge fluke if you grab a ball in mid air with your laser gun.
-Lags on my comp (thats just my problem :P)

Overall it's a very promising game. Ten bucks is a reasonable price, that is ONCE they get a good amount of the servers filled up. I'd still recommend buying it now, but don't expect to see many other people online right as you open it. I've met 2 only so far.

review:

Hands down to the audio dept! Perfect music for a fast thrilled match and makes me serious while playing. 
All the best guys :D i hope this game would turn out what you hoped to accomplish!

review: I first played this at Insomnia in 2013 as a team contesting for the top spot. It was stupidly competive from the get go. Definitely e-sport material! Want a little game to play with your friend competitively? Get this!

author: {'steamid': '76561198082719213', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 514, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 365, 'last_played': 1407591968}
review:
So I really liked this game when it first came out. One of my friends got a 4-pack during the free weekend and we all played a few hours. 3 days later the community was dead and there was nobody on any of the servers. I've been thinking about why this happened.

First of all,  the player has only 3 weapons- the projectile weapon (rocket launcher), the railgun (sniper weapon), and melee. Out of the 6 plants that players can plant on captured platforms, only the turret and the ramp are useful in most situations. This severely limits the player's playstyle and makes the overall game less interesting.

Secondly, because the three combat options are hitting a fast moving enemy with your fist while moving very fast, shooting a fast moving enemy with a projectile weapon with a tiny area of effect, or sniping a fast moving enemy without any sort of scope there will be a huge skill gap. New players will have a very hard time actually doing anything, so they won't want to stick around. The only way to get better is to practice.

This brings me to my third point; you can't practice because there is nobody to practice against. Most of the time, there are zero players on. The only time anyone is on is for the weekly dev game and the occasional password-protected tournament match.

Also, a lot of the maps aren't much fun to play. The only good maps are the ones with ball spawn areas that are much lower than the goals. Putting the ball spawn lower down makes it easily accessible from multiple routes, making it harder to camp the ball. It also makes it easier to defend because the ball carrier has to climb all the way up to the goal. On a flat map, one team gets to the ball first, camps there, and can easily hold off the other team while they send one player to zip across the map with a powerup and score instantly over and over again.

To the devs- I still think this game is very promising. If you can update it to make it more diverse and suitable for multiple playstyles and narrow the skill gap, then get it featured on the store frontpage with a sale you might be able to build a lasting player base.

author: {'steamid': '76561198040866797', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 696, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'last_played': 1399171907}
review: I played this over the free weekend, well actually i just played it for about 6 hours straight over one night and i loved it. At first i didn't have a clue what was going on and there were a few bugs i came across. One that i can remember was that i could only chat using enter and that was to "all" so i couldn't just talk to my team (tried changing controls but to no avail) That was only a minor glitch and didn't really effect the fun i had. Once i got used to the jumping mechanics and worked out the loadout system i.e. what plants to choose, what they are all about and how important they are to getting an advantage over the other team i really got into it. When new players came in to a game i did find myself having to explain all that i'd worked out about the game, like what plants do, the fact that you had to power them up after planting them etc. I felt it my duty in the interest of fair play to also tell new players that you could power down the other teams plants and distroy them by planting your own in their place. This i did kind of reluctantly but as i said it wouldn't have been fair if i hadn't passed this crucial info on. ANYWAY... Great game, simple and very addictive plus it's one of those games that take you a while to really master (more time than i had playing it) which is NOT a bad thing. Looking forward with interest to see how the game progresses as work continues on it. Get it now though as it's still totally playable in it's current state. One warning i would put out there is that after a while playing you may suffer from a sore thumb from all the jumping (using space), but that may have just been me. :)

author: {'steamid': '76561197973306173', 'num_games_owned': 1020, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 368, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 349, 'last_played': 1393615134}
review:
Juego muy divertido y entretenido, pero se nota que está en Alpha. Los servidores se caen facilmente siendo difícil jugar más de dos o 3 partidas seguidas. Si dispones de una subida decente puedes servear y poco a poco irá entrando la gente. 

El juego en sí es de mecánica sencilla. Saltas, coges la pelota y la lanza contra la "portería" contraria. Cada vez que marcas un gol, reapareces con una semilla en la mano y la debes de plantar en las distintas plataformas grandes de la pantalla. Estas semillas realizan una acción en particular y dan un efecto pasivo (las semillas que tienes disponibles se pueden configurar desde el menú principal). 

Hay dos formas de ganar. Ser el equipo que más a marcado cuando finalice el tiempo o plantar tu semilla en la zona inicial del contrincante (solo puedes hacerlo si antes has plantado en las plataformas que hay entre tu zona inicial y la del enemigo, vamos, que no tienes que plantar en todas las zonas del juego).

En este momento del Alpha hay dos armas, un lanzamisiles de energia (que es el que usa todo el mundo) y un rayo laser (que nadie usa porque es lento, muy lento y poco efectivo). Espero que esto lo vayan mejorando para darle más variedad. 

Los disparos no matan pero empujan al enemigo (o amigo), por lo que si el enemigo tiene la bola, tendrás que dispararle para  que se caiga de las plataformas. 

Y llegamos al punto más delicado y principal del juego: Los saltos. Al principio es muy dificil manejar bien como funcionan los saltos en el juego, ya que se tienen que cargar (Con hasta 3 niveles de fuerza), en el juego hay una relativa baja gravedad por lo que te permite tener cierta maniobrabilidad en el aire. Además hay doble salto (Triple si disparas primero contra el suelo). Pero cuando le pillas el truco, el juego se vuelve realmente divertido... y competitivo. 

Pros: 
- Partidas rápidas.
- Competitivo.
- Dinámico.

Contras:
- Falta de armas.
- Dificultad elevada nada más empezar.
- Problemas con los servidores.
- Imposibilidad de jugar partidas con el equipo Preseleccionado (Con todos tus amigos en el mismo equipo).

(Probablemente los contras los irán arreglando conforme avance la beta)

review:
Sehr schönes Game, erinnert mich an Tron vermischt mit Quidditch(von Harry Potter)
Klar es hat noch einige Bugs, welche ich jetzt nicht als schlimm empfinde bzw. die ich fast nicht bemerkt habe :)
Im großen und ganzen könnte diese Game vlt auch bald im E-Sport gespielt werden (hat ja genügend Vorraussetzungen und ein großes Potenzial)
Der Preis von 8.99 ist gerechtfertigt, wenn man bedenkt das ein COD-DLC 15,- Euro kostet
Das Spiel macht Laune und wird ja noch entwickel. So werden bestimmt neue Maps, Waffen und Features folgen.
Probs an die entwickler ;)

author: {'steamid': '76561197991263703', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 64, 'playtime_forever': 285, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 59, 'last_played': 1407036349}
review: Awesome game. Even though it is still in development and I only played it for a few hours on the free weekend event, I found it really fun and it gave me an amazing Quake feel. Do you remember those Quake maps filled with jump pads and death pits? Hell yes! The major problem I have with Epigenesis is with my ping, wich can be a pain in the *ss when I'm playing against people with 5 to 10 ping while mine is varying betwen 57 to 70. Besides that I can firmly say that every play you do in a match, whether it is a well timed jump, pushing somebody off of the platform, scoring for your team or whatever else you manage to do right, it is all super enjoyable and even when you do screw up it can be fun while not being heavily punished for it. Unfortunately I missed the sale :( but next time it'll be a sure purchase ;)

author: {'steamid': '76561198038057741', 'num_games_owned': 250, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 561, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 376, 'last_played': 1529522940}
review:
Посмотрел я отзывы на эту игру и не нашел ни одного годного. Ни отрицательного, ни положительного. Многие просто не поняли, как в это играть. А для того, чтобы понять суть Epigenesis, надо было поиграть в две игры: Unreal Tournament 2k4, откуда взялся данный режим (Bobmbing Run), и Tribes, где б[b]о[/b]льшую часть времени люди проводили в воздухе, а не на земле, поэтому и попасть по кому-либо было сложно. Если не играли в них, то Epigenesis, скорее всего, вам не дастся. Если играли и вам нравилось - обязательно попробуйте.

  Что имеем? Две команды, один мяч и двое ворот, в которые этот мяч надо забить. Слишком просто? Добавим сюда платформы, висящие в воздухе/космосе, оружие, паверапы, семена растений, двойной прыжок и еще много-много всего. Вот теперь сложно. И я ведь даже не сказал о комбинациях всего этого. Мне, например, было очевидно, что если я вместе с прыжком выстрельну себе под ноги, то полечу гораздо дальше и быстрее. Однако новичок вряд ли до этого догадается.
  Кстати, об оружии. В этой игре нет "жизней", оружие может лишь оттолкнуть игрока, чтобы он слетел с платформы и упал вниз. У оружия два типа огня: ракетница (снаряд летит медленно, но хорошо отталкивает) и рейлган (мгновенное попадание, но почти не толкает игрока). 
 Также в Epigenesis есть очень странная вещь - семена. Одно семя выдается игроку сразу, как только он забил гол. И с этого момента игра становится не просто футболом, а футболом с захватом точек! Семя надо сажать на какую-либо платформу. Как только посадите, оттуда вырастет растение, которое даст определенные бонусы двух типов: активные и пассивные. К активным относятся: туррель, стреляющая по врагам; дым или щит, мешающие команде противника попасть по вам и даже огромная ветвь (если не ствол) дерева, позволяющая попасть на ранее недоступные платформы. Среди пассивных есть увеличение скорости ходьбы, контроля персонажа в полете, темпа стрельбы и т.п.  Но их надо выбирать в специальном разделе меню до начала игры - это ужасно неудобно.

 Сейчас в игре творится хаос. Все идет по схеме "забираю мяч, иду напролом, молюсь, чтобы никто не попал по мне". А все остальные пытаются, но безрезультатно, попасть друг по другу. Зато через год это уже будет неплохая киберспортивная игра, где будет нужен не только скилл и хорошая реакция, но и умение мыслить и давать команде нужные ей бонусы на данный момент. Вот только будет ли она популярна - это хороший вопрос.

author: {'steamid': '76561198017401260', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 64, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 64, 'last_played': 1391375006}
review:
[u][b]Rugby reloaded[/b][/u]

Sehr gutes Multiplayergame, welches mit ein bisschen Feinschliff sicher das Potential hat ganz oben mitzuspielen. Die Einarbeitungszeit ist trotz relativ unübersichtlichen Tutorial sehr kurz. Zwar besitzt Epigenesis immer den gleichen [b]"roten Faden"[/b] im Spielablauf, allerdings erhält es durch die zahlreichen plants und maps ein gewisses Maß an Abwechslung und Vielfalt. Dennoch kommt beim Spielen hin und wieder der Gedanke an das Gute Alte Rugby auf.

author: {'steamid': '76561198024771866', 'num_games_owned': 234, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 45, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 45, 'last_played': 1391368547}
review: Игра представляет из себя спортивный экшен с геймплеем наподобии "capture the flag". Задумка подобная точно не нова. В том же Unreal версий начала 2K тоже присутствовал режим борьба за флаг, только там это все было в разы бодрее и разнообразнее как в плане оружия и карт так и возможностей в целом. Главная беда этой игры в том что это банально не завершенный проект с 3 картами 1 режимом но зато тонной багов. В игре где карты построненны на так что приходится делать затяжные прыжки (привет старый добрый Quake) из за лагов постоянно кидает вверх-вниз когда находишься в полете. Еще одной особенностью игры является то что противника ты не убиваешь оружием напрямую, а только отталкиваешь и тем самым можешь скинуть с платформ. Но БОЛЬШАЯ проблема в том что герои на карте жутко мелкие и учитывая это и постоянные лаги попадать по кому либо приходится практически на угад. Скачал я эту игру так как люблю олдскульные шутеры в духе Quake, где разбежки были невероятными, сам бой крайне динамичным и где можно было реально посоревноваться. Эта игра даже после релиза не сможет стать интересной. Для тех кому интересны спортивные FPS без прокачки и тонны шмота могу посоветовать SHOOTMANIA, реально интересный проект!

author: {'steamid': '76561198019679816', 'num_games_owned': 880, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 242, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 179, 'last_played': 1438287689}
review:
Epigenesis is a kind of fast-paced arena shooter.
The rules are simple, take the ball, bring it to the ennemy base and score a goal to gain 1 point. But that won't be easy because a bunch of angry men are running at you firing lasers and trying to punch you, turrets are shooting huge projectiles right in your face and some tornados are here to bring pain and misery. Yep, it's not 2k14.
That game is pretty similar to quake or unreal. You can double jump, you can find bonus on the ground (blink, grab, pushback aoe etc), you are firing rockets and lasers. Jumping is the key of the game, the arenas are made of platforms and you to have to jump from one to another, there is no real ground. That means that you can fall and die really often if you fail your jumps. 
Weapons are pretty original, the first one fires rocket that'll push your ennemys away or pull them to you, the second one is a laser that stops instantly the ennemy movement (really effective when shooting a men while he is in the air, he'll fall to death). You also get a construction laser. 
Yes a construction laser! When a player scores, he gains a seed. This seed can be used on the biggest platforms to create a bonus. These bonus consist of turrets, mortars, ramps, shields, smokescreen and trench. Each of these bonus will help your team to win, choose them wisely because they can change the battlefield a lot. Each of these contructions also brings you a passiv bonus like an acceleration boost, a higher fire rate etc. But be carefull because the other team can destroy them and make you loose the bonus.

I really enjoyed it, it's not bug free but it's pretty solid at what it does. Give it a try!

author: {'steamid': '76561198084028414', 'num_games_owned': 396, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 5, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5, 'last_played': 1391349537}
review:
Конечно Epigenesis не самая плохая игра, что я видел. Конечно идея о футболе в "далекай далекай галактике" придет в голуво любому фанату России по футболу увидев как наши инопланетные сушества "футболисты" ползоют по полю хотя как ползуют, стоят. Но ладно не будем о грусном. Горафика верней её наличее остовляет желать лудшего. Гемплей здесь не самый крутой иногда даже можно провалится в текстуры. Звук кривой не качественый. Но убить пару часов можно.

мои оценки
графика 3/10
гемплей 2/10
звук 2/10
идея 7/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198035965214', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 40, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 40, 'last_played': 1391318694}
review:
I don't know if the people that make this game know that this is a bad game, but it's a bad game. Even the main menu is laggy and it's not because of my computer. There is very little direction as what to do, despite a tutorial. Most maps are unplayable due to the fact that every player has the same gun and it's far too difficult to manuever. Additionally the live voice action in the game sounds like an untrained swedish individual garbling through a soda can into a potato on a stick microphone. There is literally no worse way to spend money unless you're trying to sieze your brain through epilectic shock and poor gameplay mechanics. There is no server space in the United States and the latenency causes tick delay/frame cuts that make the game unplayable.

I give it 1/0 stars because it's abominable content is undefined in terms of atrocity.

Fast-paced, colourful, jumping. What more do you want? 
It is pretty confusing at the start but once you get used to it (and I'm talking an hour or so here) it's easy to manuver and get goals.

author: {'steamid': '76561198079111954', 'num_games_owned': 199, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 144, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 85, 'last_played': 1461031560}
review: This game is awesome. If anyone has played Halo Reach, Halo 3 or even just watched Red VS Blue, chances are you will ahve memories of Grifball. This is Grifball on steroids. This is everything you wanted out of Grifball. This is the Grifball standalone. But dont just think of this game as Grifball, this game has more potential than your mother ever thought you had. This game is early access so there are some bugs and some things to be improved such as including East and West US dedicated servers (This is being worked in but is hard as the game is based out of Europe). When people hear "Early Access Game" they think not ready or not enjoyable or possibly not even interesting. This proves those people wrong. The amasing thing about this game being Early Access is that it can only get better and go up from here.

author: {'steamid': '76561198036565820', 'num_games_owned': 240, 'num_reviews': 27, 'playtime_forever': 24, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 24, 'last_played': 1391264920}
review:
This reminds me of Super Smash Bros. and Ricochet
The Good Is:
1. The only way to kill an enemy is by ringing him out of the stage
2. Shooting does only knockback
3. Fast Paced Basketball
4. Futuristic
5. Really simple
6. Requires reflexes
7. Varied maps
The Bad:
 Nothing really, althrough some times I was double jumping, and I glitch into plataforms, making me fly away, and the really simple maybe is a negative for some, since this is a different take on Arena FPS.

author: {'steamid': '76561198041579759', 'num_games_owned': 633, 'num_reviews': 79, 'playtime_forever': 7, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 7, 'last_played': 1391147098}
review: Бесплатные выходные. Почему бы не скачать? Решил протестировать эту игру, о которой я никогда не слышал. По скринам все выглядит интересно и бодро. Но на деле... В общем, "скачал, запустил, удалил" - именно так можно охарактеризовать игру. Не тратьте свое время, а уж тем более деньги, на эту недоделку. Это просто бред, не достойный внимания. Зачем засоряют стим подобным мусором - не понятно...

author: {'steamid': '76561197990548584', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 28, 'playtime_forever': 151, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 151, 'last_played': 1391149892}
review:
I reccommend this game after Playing Just two hours and can say its a decent game and has some really good playability. 

Ill name the Pros and cons of the game that i can see.

Pros:
Quick Fast pace action constant movement; Youll rarely see someone stand still for long.
Very nice to look at.
Constant change of the field. With the plants being placed and such after each capture can change the tides of the battle from ramps to shields or Turrets to mortars. 
Takes Teamwork to a decent extent. if everyone is working togeather instead of shoot his/her teammate cause they have the ball you have a huge chance to win.
Easy controls, After learning everything's place you can quickly adapt to play like anyone else.

Cons:
The jumping system requires you to charge it for higher jumps and takes a while to do so and ends up costing you the ball or a intercept.
People can bounce off your head and will use that as a advantage to get to the goal along side using turrets to fly across the map within a second Making the game feel very unfair. 
Attacks sometimes somehow get overcharged and send you flying 2 to 3 times farther than it should from one shot.

Now thats all the pros and cons i can think of but i got what i feel are the biggest points. and i personally love this game. Its pros outweight the cons for sure.

author: {'steamid': '76561198050410974', 'num_games_owned': 844, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 255, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 173, 'last_played': 1405051275}
review:
If you fondly remember Ricochet then you will feel right at home with Epigenesis, a graphically-modern future-sport with much much more.  Two small teams bouncing around platforms, struggling to pay attention to the other players as the beautiful maps distract so easily.  Then you see some plants popping up on platforms around you as players start scoring.  Hold on, plants? in a future sports first-person shooter?!  Yep and they are what makes the game something really truly unique.  Each plant provides actual physical objects that either buff such as speed boosts, air control, shields, they provide new ledges (actually changing the playing area), turrets, mortars, and more!  The game already feels really unique as you could coordinate a variety of different team playstyles but I am just imagining even more plants and drooling at the mouth with the variety! The sweet juicy variety!

This game is really original and fun it just needs more players!  Get on this weekend, log in to a server.  There will be tons of people playing on Saturday and Sunday for sure!  You will NOT be disappointed.

review:
Epigenesis is the most fun I've had when it comes to gaming in years.
It's a fast paced action game that combines two great genres perfectly. You get the aiming and shooting part from first person shooters and the action and strategic elements from sports games.

Epigenesis takes half an hour to learn, but I bet it will take ages to master. I think everyone should give it a try.

See you on the field of battle! :)

author: {'steamid': '76561197981062699', 'num_games_owned': 908, 'num_reviews': 26, 'playtime_forever': 5239, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3871, 'last_played': 1456216675}
review:
Top notch game if you like hectic twitch shooters combined with teamplay and a hint of strategy. Fast paced combat with a hitscan railgun and projectile based rocket gun in a low gravity platform environment where one wrong move and you fall to your death. All of this mixed with the ball scoring gameplay and the seed system, allowing you to shape the battlefield with various types of offensive/defensive plants and give your team passive bonuses.

Devs are great guys and always open to suggestions, and organize a night where they all come on to play with people on Sunday nights. The game doesn't have a huge playerbase right now which is why servers are often empty, but it definitely deserves a chance.

Oh yeah and its £6.99, so you can't really lose.

author: {'steamid': '76561198054105945', 'num_games_owned': 639, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 12633, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4426, 'last_played': 1663711959}
review:
If you like LAZORS, Flying through the air and balls, you'll love this game. Action-packed game with constant battles for the ball and land possesion. Never a dull moment with this game. Form a group with some friends, start a team, develop tac-tics and play agains the people of the game, or sign up for the frequent community tournaments. Or play by yourself with whoever else is online. Cool consept, amazingly well executed, awesome design and great gameplay. 
Really cool game, loads of updates, still in alpha and still the best game I've played in months!
Not enough people own it!

author: {'steamid': '76561198061625154', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 321, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 308, 'last_played': 1422926616}
review:
Epigenesis
	*Note: The game is in early access and is still being worked on. Everything said in this review is subject to change.	

           Epigenesis is a first person frantic shooter. The game was released on Steam as an early access game on November 1, 2013. Now you would expect an early access game that's only in its alpha stage, would have some issues but believe it or not, this game is pretty well set. This doesn't mean that the game is perfect, there are a few issues, but nothing that stops you from enjoying this game.
	So what exactly is Epigenesis? Well its a first person shooter, but it has much more than your average shooter. Your main goal as the player is to grab the ball and throw it into the other teams gate. This then gives your team a point, as well as a power up. Power ups add let you modify the map. You can do all sorts of stuff including adding another path or causing a tornado. If somebody has the ball and they fall over the edge, but don't manage to pass it to another player, the ball resets. It is also possible to intercept the ball from the enemy. This makes the person who has the ball have a reason to score quickly. The game also has pickups which allow you to be more mobile. Now, if you have the ball, you're all set for the most part. Your main problem is not jumping to your death. Trying to shoot the enemy players when they have the ball is quite difficult. I found that using the rapid fire weapon was very ineffective, however, using the rail gun, I was able to get some shots on people. The game, currently, only has two weapons(as of 12/7/13). This is a little disappointing because a variety of weapons would add a variety of strategies. The rail gun itself does no damage, it can either push or pull somebody if you land a hit. The rapid fire gun is your damage dealing gun, but it's very difficult to hit somebody. The player can move quickly and unpredictably. This is both good and bad. Its good because it keeps you safe, but, its bad because if your shooting you had better be a good shot. This does add challenge and excitement to the game, especially when your able finally get a connected shot.
	
	Epigenesis adds different froms of challenge and fun through its unique maps. The maps are made up of a variety of floating
 square surfaces and building tops. You jump from panel to panel, trying to reach the ball first, usually is located in the center. Some maps offer launch pads which send you flying across the map and onto another panel(picture above shows a player being launched). This can be used as an escape route, and offensive route, or just extra fun. When you grab this ball, you can't shoot, so you have to rely on running. With the multiple pickups and launch pads, you can make your way to score a goal with no problem, that is until somebody gets a good shot on you and sends you off the map. But, if this happens, the ball and you simply re-spawn, after a short countdown, at the designated spots, and you continue playing. 

	The game only has one game mode(as of 12/7/13) which is to grab the ball and send it through the enemy’s gate. This still offers plenty of fun and hours of entertainment. Eventually though the same thing gets a bit old, but I feel that the developers will add more, remember the game is only in alpha. There is one problem that puts a damper on things, the lack of players. The game allows for 5v5 matches, however the biggest I have even been involved in is a 4v3. This, however, is not a permanent issue. I have only seen three servers on my game, but once the game is closer to actual release, there will more than likely be plenty of servers, and people. Most of the time I am able to get into a match that is 2v2. This does restrict what this game truly has to offer. If you have ever played Quake you will know that more people equals more fun. The developers were trying to make their own “Quake style” game. 

	Epigenesis is something you should look out for. Unlike these new shooters that have been the same for the past 5 games, this game is unique and contains countless hours of fun. Since the game is only in alpha there are still many more advancements that can take place in this game. The good part about it being an early access game is that the developers will listen to the community and respond to what players say. If you love fast paced games like Quake, or just want to try something new, Eigenesis should be on your wishlist as soon as your done reading this review.


for more great reviews visit http://kingsjelly.tumblr.com/

review: I'd really love to see this game finished. Cant wait for the community to become bigger. Otherwise, a game with very interesting mechanics. It involves taking a ball and scoring it. Its something like rugby, but with guns. You can score airshots I believe, just like in Quake/TF2. There are also power-ups in some locations where you can pick up and use them to your advantage.

author: {'steamid': '76561197995467446', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 31, 'playtime_forever': 136, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 131, 'last_played': 1385462403}
review:
Amazing twitchy game. The game is based on bringing an orb from the center of the map and throwing it in the other teams goal, located several platforms away. Doing so gives you a seed which you plant on the platforms to provide powerups. All players are provided a rifle which propels players shot, both teammates and enemies, which, when used properly, leads to an very interesting gameplay. 

The developers are very forward sometimes join games in progress, which is nice and helps make the small community better. The only negative is the small community, which is something I hope goes away over time!

author: {'steamid': '76561198056396745', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 58, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 20, 'last_played': 1439248240}
review: When I still lived in the UK, about a year ago I went to the gadget show live (big gadget convention based on a tv show). They had this thing called Make Something Unreal 2012 where they invited people from universities to make games using the unreal engine. The finalists (there were four) were having demonstrations and they set about 16 gaming pcs up for us to test the game. It was in really early alpha at that stage and it still is alpha, but of the four games there was no doubt this was by far the best. I voted for this game by Dead Shark Triple Punch (awesome name) and it won the most votes in the end. If I were to explain it, it'd be something like, sport basketball of the future with low gravity, genetically engineered plants that give you bonuses the more goals you score, jetpacks, fast paced awesomeness and guns that don't harm but knockback. graphic style is kind of like super moday night combat, or team fortress 2.
